alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 13 at 6:43AM PST until January 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow for elevations mainly above 5000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph over exposed terrain and frequent blowing snow causing reduced visibility. * WHERE...South Central and Southern Oregon Cascades and higher portions of the Siskiyou Mountains. This includes Diamond Lake Junction, Crater Lake and Lake Of The Woods. This also includes highways 62, 138, 230, 58, and 140 in the Cascades. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST tonight. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible due to snow and a wintry mix. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Isolated power outages are possible. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
